references.reason: This book is a foundational text in causal inference, providing the theoretical basis for much of the work in this paper.
This paper provides the theoretical guarantee for the identifiability of the mixture of Gaussian distributions used in this paper to disentangle the mixed data.

references.paper_title: Permutation-based causal structure learning with unknown intervention targets
references.reason: This paper introduces the UT-IGSP algorithm, which is used in this paper to identify the causal graph from the disentangled interventional distributions.

references.paper_title: A linear non-gaussian acyclic model for causal discovery
references.reason: This paper establishes the identifiability of causal graphs from observational data under certain conditions, providing a crucial background for understanding the challenges of causal discovery with interventions.

references.paper_title: Causal protein-signaling networks derived from multiparameter single-cell data
references.reason: This paper introduces a real-world biological dataset used in this paper to demonstrate the practical application of the proposed algorithm.
